title: What technological innovation has benefited you the most? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is arguably only one answer to this question in terms of net impact. In terms of both impact to quality of life as well as education and continually refining the next generation no technology can surpass the computer. It has gone from the size of buildings, to the size of rooms, to something that could fit on a desk, to something that fits in your hand, and coming in the near future to something that can literally be integrated into the body. All means of production today is pinned to the use and proliferation of computation while every industry is being continually transformed by it and thus the computer and its software is the technological innovation having impacted all people, globally to the highest extent of any technology.

Its not just one thing! After I moved to metro city from rural village for my higher studies and work, I hardly had a chance to talk to or get to know more about my elementary, middle and high school friends.  But now with help of Internet, Smart Phone, Social Media and Messaging apps , I could able to connect to most of my school friends and able to talk to them. It is an amazing feeling to talk to my friends after ten, twenty years and bringing those old golden memories. Now most of my friends are in whatsapp group, so daily we are able to chat and discuss. Thanks to technology!

The computer. My profession exists because of it. However it has also spawned the internet which spawned the world wide web which resulted in social media. Due to social media I now interact with my cousins in Scotland at least once a month if not more after about 20 years of sporadic cards. That is a huge benefit to my happiness.

frozen pizza The most important fundamentals underpinning modern society are FoodWritingThe LawLow cost, reliable ENERGYTake them away, and modern society disappears in HOURS. Computers, Internet, Facebook, the Kardashians are utterly irrelevant without these fundamentals. The Industrial Revolution in the UK was underpinned and preceded by the agricultural revolution. Nearly everyone alive in developed countries has never known Life without them. This makes them ubiquitous, and so in a sense invisible. Hopefully, we won't lose them…
The internet. People who have specialized interests, or not the same as everyone in their hometown, can meet others and see that they’re not alone and feel less isolated.
Surgery and anesthesia. I probably would not have lived past age 29 without both.
